intro: Dissotis autraniana, commonly known as the golden shower vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its dense clusters of yellow, pendulous flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Dissotis autraniana is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
